alert.note: Alert for Northeast Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 8:38PM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 10 and 18 inches above 4000 feet. Below 4000 feet up to 10 inches. Winds gusting to 65 mph or higher. Blowing and drifting snow with visibilities one quarter mile or less. * WHERE...Mountain Road, Peola, Anatone, and Cloverland Road. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact travel Monday night through Wednesday. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds on Monday will gust as high as 30 mph. Tuesday through Wednesday morning is when winds will be the strongest, gusting to 55 mph or higher.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
